title: 2002 Norwegian First Division
text:
The 2002 <a href="1.%20divisjon">1. divisjon</a>, <a href="Norway">Norway</a>'s second-tier <a href="association%20football">football</a> league, began play on 14 April 2002 and ended on 27 October 2002. The league was contested by 16 teams, and the top two teams won promotion to <a href="Tippeligaen">Tippeligaen</a>, while the third placed played a promotion-playoff against the 12th-placed team in Tippeligaen to win promotion. The bottom four teams were relegated to the <a href="2.%20divisjon">2. divisjon</a>.
<a href="Troms%C3%B8%20IL">Tromsø</a> and <a href="Aalesunds%20FK">Aalesund</a> won promotion to Tippeligaen, while <a href="Hamarkameratene">Ham-Kam</a> lost the promotion-playoff against <a href="Bryne%20FK">Bryne</a>. <a href="%C3%85sane%20Fotball">Åsane</a>, <a href="Tromsdalen%20UIL">Tromsdalen</a>, <a href="L%C3%B8renskog%20IF">Lørenskog</a> and <a href="Tollnes%20BK">Tollnes</a> was relegated to the 2. divisjon.
League table.
